task.title: Quickstart: load data and run common queries
task.shortdesc: Load the datasets and run example queries for direct routes, connections, and return flights.

prereq.p: You need Python 3.9+ and the module files (Airport.py, Flight.py, Assign4.py).

info.codeblock:
from Assign4 import loadData
ok = loadData("data/airports.txt", "data/flights.txt") print(ok) # True on success; False on any file open/read/parsing error

step.cmd: Look up an airport by code.

info.codeblock:
from Assign4 import getAirportByCode
ord_airport = getAirportByCode("ORD") print(ord_airport) # e.g., ORD(Chicago,United States) depending on __repr__

step.cmd: Find flights involving a city or country.

info.codeblock:
from Assign4 import findAllCityFlights, findAllCountryFlights
toronto_flights = findAllCityFlights("Toronto") brazil_flights = findAllCountryFlights("Brazil")
print(len(toronto_flights), len(brazil_flights))

step.cmd: Find a direct flight or a one-stop connection.

info.codeblock:
from Assign4 import findFlightBetween, getAirportByCode
# Direct example (returns a string) print(findFlightBetween(getAirportByCode("PVG"), getAirportByCode("YOW")))
# One-stop example (returns a set of connecting airport codes) print(findFlightBetween(getAirportByCode("DEL"), getAirportByCode("YYZ")))

step.cmd: Find a return flight for a given flight.

info.codeblock:
from Assign4 import allFlights, findReturnFlight
first = allFlights["YYZ"][1] # Example: one flight departing YYZ return_flight = findReturnFlight(first)
print(first) print(return_flight) # Flight object or -1 if none exists

result.p: You can now load data, run lookups and filters, and retrieve direct/one-stop routes and return flights.
